taglib.info: Tag library for MMBase based on MMCI(MMBase Cloud Interface).

tag.name: list
tag.info: The list tag provides a syntax to list objects managed by MMBase.

attribute.name: nodes
attribute.info: Comma-separated list of nodes, this attribute defines the starting point of the list. The parameter is equivalent to node.

attribute.name: node
attribute.info: Node number, or node alias. This attribute defines the starting point of the list.

attribute.name: type
attribute.info: A comma-separated list of NodeManagers and/or RelationManagers. The list forms a "chain of relations"

attribute.name: fields
attribute.info: Comma-separated list of fields that should be made available in the page. The fields are selected from attributes of the corresponding node managers defined in type. If the type fields contains more elements eg type="mags,news" then it is required to append a prefix to each field listed eg fields="mags.title,news.title".In the jsp page the values are available in form of Strings eg mags.title is available as mags_title and can be accessed using <%= mags_title >.

attribute.name: command
attribute.info: On a non-multilevel list, you can also do a 'command'. The 'getList(command)' method from the NodeManager interface will be called then.

attribute.name: sorted
attribute.info: The fields on which the result set must be sorted.

attribute.name: direction
attribute.info: The direction of sorting.

attribute.name: max
attribute.info: The maximum number of results.

attribute.name: offset
attribute.info: The start index.

attribute.name: id
attribute.info: See the 'id' attribute of the Node tag.

tag.name: related
tag.info: The list tag provides a syntax to list objects managed by MMBase

tag.name: even
tag.info: The tag can be used in a list to determine if this is an even item

tag.name: odd
tag.info: The tag can be used in a list to determine if this is an even item

tag.name: changed
tag.info: The tag can be used in a list to determine if this is an even item

tag.name: head
tag.info: The tag can be used in a list to determine if this is the fist item in the list.

tag.name: tail
tag.info: The tag can be used in a list to determine if this is the fist item in the list.

tag.name: cloud
tag.info: The cloud tag initializes the cloud to use.

attribute.name: name
attribute.info: The name of the cloud.

attribute.name: logon
attribute.info: The authentication name to use (account).

attribute.name: pwd
attribute.info: The password to use to logon to the cloud.

attribute.name: method
attribute.info: Describes how to get the authentication information.

possiblevalue.info: use http protocol to ask name and password from the user. If the 'logon' attribute is specified too, then logging on will fail if the user does not use that username. The 'pwd' attribute will be ignored.
Ignore the 'logon' attribute and create (or reuse) a cloud with an anonymous user.
Ignore the 'logon' attribute and reuse the cloud as it is in the session.

attribute.name: authenticate
attribute.info: The authentitation module which must be used by the security system. The default is "name/password", which will do in most cases.

tag.name: mod
tag.info: This tag can be used to call features provided by Modules in MMBase.

tag.name: info
tag.info: This tag can be used to call getInfo from Module (can also be done with mod) and NodeManager.

tag.name: node
tag.info: A tag to make a node available. Normally it will enclose some field tags.

attribute.name: number
attribute.info: The nodenumber or alias identifying this node in MMBase.

attribute.name: parameter
attribute.info: The request parameter name which contains the nodenumber or alias indentifying this node in MMBase.

attribute.name: fields
attribute.info: The fields you want to have from this node. Other fields are available as well, but will only be accessible with the field-tag. Field indicated in this 'fields' attribute will also get a jsp-variable.

attribute.name: id
attribute.info: With the 'id' attribute you define an unique identifier for this node. At the same time this defines an jsp 'Node' variable with this name. If you have defined 'fields' too, then these fields will have jsp-variables prefixed with this id and an underscore.

attribute.name: type
attribute.info: A comma-separated list of NodeManagers and/or RelationManagers. The list forms a "chain of relations".

tag.name: field
tag.info: Gets the field 'name' from node 'node' (can also be list).

attribute.name: node
attribute.info: The 'id' of the node or list from which this field must be taken. By default this is the node or list which is enclosing this field.

attribute.name: name
attribute.info: The name of the field to get.

attribute.name: head
attribute.info: Like 'name', but does not return the value of the field, but the GUI-name of the field.

possiblevalue.info: Show only when row number is odd.
Show only when row number is even.
Show only when this row differs from the previous row.

attribute.name: inverse
attribute.info: Inverse the sense of the condition.

attribute.name: list
attribute.info: The id of the list to which this condition must apply to. Default it is the enclosing one.
